title: Fairly heavy showers expected today
byline: The Intertropical Convergence Zone (where winds from the Northern Hemisphere and Southern Hemisphere converge) affects the island’s weather, the Department of Meteorology says.

title: 15 rallies in Colombo for May Day celebrations
byline: Political parties and trade unions across Sri Lanka are commemorating International Labour Day today (May 01) with a series of May Day rallies and parades under various themes.

title: Ukraine, US sign minerals deal sought by Trump
byline: Ukraine and the U.S. on Wednesday signed a deal heavily promoted by U.S. President Donald Trump that will give the United States preferential access to new Ukrainian minerals deals and fund investment in Ukraine’s reconstruction.

title: Govt. initiated stable economic recovery - President in his May Day message
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that the government has already succeeded in initiating a stable recovery of an economy that was dragged to the depths by corrupt and elitist system.

title: Health authorities sound alarm over spike in mosquito-borne diseases
byline: The National Dengue Control Unit (NDCU) reports that a total of 17,459 dengue cases have been recorded so far in 2025, with 5,018 cases reported in April alone.

title: Systematic program set up to strengthen economic forces of all working people: PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya says that marking a historic turning point, this year’s May Day for is celebrated under a people’s government that rises against five years of oppression by the ruling class, overthrowing corrupted politics.

title: Sajith calls on working community to break free from mindset rooted in isolated poverty
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa called on the working people to break free from a mindset rooted in isolated poverty and strive to contribute meaningfully to global economic stability, where workers have been both directly and indirectly impacted by the trade wars that have emerged in the global market.

title: North Korea and Russia begin construction of first road bridge
byline: North Korea has said the development of its first road bridge to Russia is a “significant” milestone in relations between the two countries, according to the country’s state media KCNA.

title: 24 major reservoirs overflow amid heavy rainfall
byline: The Department of Irrigation says 24 major reservoirs under its administration are currently overflowing due to the heavy rainfall experienced across the island.

title: No revision in three-wheel fares despite fuel price reduction
byline: The All Ceylon Three-Wheeler Drivers’ Trade Union says they will not revise fares despite the latest fuel price reduction.

title: Martin Scorsese producing documentary featuring Pope Francis’ final on-camera interview
byline: Renowned Hollywood filmmaker Martin Scorsese is set to produce a new documentary that will feature the late Pope Francis’ last on-camera interview.

title: Train derails near Colombo Fort railway station
byline: A train has reportedly derailed near the Colombo Fort Railway Station this morning (01).

title: No bus fare revision despite diesel price reduction
byline: Bus fares will not be revised despite the reduction in the price of a litre of auto diesel by Rs. 12 yesterday, Chairman of the Lanka Private Bus Association Gemunu Wijeratne has announced.

title: Late President Ranasinghe Premadasa commemorated today
byline: A commemoration ceremony was held today (01) to honor late President Ranasinghe Premadasa, who was assassinated in a bomb attack during a May Day procession 32 years ago.

title: Ex-President Ranil’s top security officer transferred to Kankesanturai
byline: Chief Inspector of Police Ashoka Ariyawansa, who served as the Chief Security Officer to former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has been transferred with immediate effect.

title: Two nabbed at BIA with forged Polish visas
byline: Two individuals who were attempting to leave the country with forged Polish visas have been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: State of emergency declared in parts of New Zealand due to severe weather
byline: Severe weather has hit New Zealand on Thursday with a State of Emergency declared in part of the country.

title: Revenue Inspector contesting LG Polls arrested for soliciting bribe
byline: A Revenue Inspector has been taken into custody by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) for allegedly soliciting a bribe.

title: Sabaragamuwa Uni student commits suicide over ragging incident
byline: A student of the Sabaragamuwa University, distraught over a ragging incident, has taken his own life.

title: US urges India and Pakistan to defuse tensions after Kashmir killings
byline: The US has urged India and Pakistan to work together to “de-escalate tensions” after a deadly militant attack in Indian-administered Kashmir last week killed 26 civilians.

title: Indian Supreme Court declines PIL seeking judicial probe into Pahalgam Terror Attack
byline: The Indian Supreme Court on Thursday (01) declined to entertain a public interest litigation (PIL) seeking a judicial inquiry by a retired Supreme Court judge into the recent terror attack on tourists in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir.

title: EU GSP+ Monitoring Mission calls on Foreign Minister
byline: A GSP+ Monitoring Mission from the European Union (EU) has called on Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath, at the Foreign Ministry.

title: Education Ministry responds to death of Sabaragamuwa Uni student
byline: The Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education states that if the recent death of a student of the Sabaragamuwa University is revealed to have been caused due to ragging, all factions responsible will be held accountable to the fullest extent of the law.
